Examine the fourth bridge
Report back to Ponta
Examine the fifth bridge
The planks of this bridge are weather-worn
Examine the sixth bridge
This bridge's planks look good!
This bridge would make a great trap! It should be repaired first
For generations, the Gochelgar family has been charged with the care of the bridges of Glyn Helyg.
Examined the bridges of Glyn Helyg  ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
This bridge is in good shape
This board is rotted and needs replacing
You should report back to Ponta about the state of the bridges.\n\nPonta Gochelgar is in Glyn Helyg.
Examine the bridges of Glyn Helyg  ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Greetings! I am Ponta Gochelgar. For generations, my family has been in charge of maintaining the bridges of Glyn Helyg. 'Tis a very important job, for a rotted bridge plank could crumble under foot or hoof.

'It is around that time of year when I need to do a full survey of each bridge, but I have been feeling pretty poorly the past few days. If you are up for the ups and downs of it, I could compensate you for the work if you will help me.

'Wonderful! The first thing we need to do is examine the bridges to be sure their ropes, planks, and anchor points are all in top shape.'
The boards are strong and secure
The Bridges of Glyn Helyg
Ponta Gochelgar has asked you to examine the bridges of Glyn Helyg for signs of rot and wear.\n\nThe bridges span the gaps along the cliffs of Glyn Helyg.
'You return! What have you found?'
Examine the first bridge

'Before my family took up the task, we had more than one sprained ankle, and a couple of spills off of the edges! But ever since my great grandmammy took it upon herself to maintain the bridges, we have not had a single serious injury or fall!\n\n'Well, due to the bridges, that is. Ol' Tipsy Gil has taken more than one spill while deeply in his cups. Luckily he managed to get tangled on his way down!'
Examine the second bridge
